newsitem.title: CANADA: DBRS confirms Magna's debt rating. [CORRECTED 23:27 GMT]
newsitem.headline: DBRS confirms Magna's debt rating. [CORRECTED 23:27 GMT]

text.p: Dominion Bond Rating Service Ltd confirmed on Tuesday an A rating on Magna International's senior debt and a R-1 low rating on the company's commercial paper.

DBRS's positive outlook for the auto parts manufacturer followed an announcement yesterday of a strategic alliance between Magna and TRW Inc for the design, development and production of automotive products for the global market.

Under the terms of the alliance, Magna will sell an 80-percent interest in two German-based operations for C$570 million - a move that will not have a "material impact" on Magna's earnings in fiscal 1997, DBRS said. (Corrects to add dropped word "not" to show the move will not have a "material impact" on the company's fiscal 1997 earnings.)
Magna will be able to provide complete interior and structural vehicle safety systems without a substantial investment, DBRS said.
DBRS added that the alliance will add to Magna's existing cash reserves, helping the company to fund its expansion strategies.
